lines.text: P = pressure, F = force, A = area

secText: Pressure involves force and area. The big feet of the lynx shown in the photograph distribute its weight over a large surface area, lowering the pressure they apply on the snow.
We show water applying force on the bottom and sides of an aquarium. The force per unit area is defined to be the pressure. The equation for pressure matches this definition, force divided by area.
The pascal is a unit for pressure.  A pascal equals one newton per square meter.  The pascal is abbreviated Pa.
